author: Daniel Konstantinovic
title: MFA sites are a persistent problem thanks to generative AI
text: New data sets, deeper insights, and flexible data visualizations. In-depth analysis, benchmarks and shorter spotlights on digital trends. Interactive projections with 10k+ metrics on market trends, & consumer behavior. Proprietary data and over 3,000 third-party sources about the most important topics. Industry benchmarks for the most important KPIs in digital marketing, advertising, retail and ecommerce. Client-only email newsletters with analysis and takeaways from the daily news. Exclusive time with the thought leaders who craft our research. The news: Artificial Intelligence could be worsening the made-for-advertising (MFA) problem. An ecommerce brand interviewed by Adweek said that as much as 40% of its recent purchases through Google‚Äôs Performance Max ended up on MFA sites. Notably, the brands in Adweek‚Äôs story did not discover their ad waste through Google‚Äôs tools. Instead, they relied on third-party services provided by Jounce and DeepSee.io. Their pursuit of third-party tools suggests a growing market for solutions to the MFA problem and a lack of transparency within Google‚Äôs own tools. Persistent problem: Despite efforts from Google and others to reduce the amount of MFA inventory plaguing digital advertising, Adweek‚Äôs report shows the problem hasn‚Äôt been dealt with‚Äìand AI is making it harder to quash. Our take: US ad spend wasted on MFA sites fell from 15% between September 2022 and January 2023 to 4% between January 2024 and May 2024, according to the Association of National Advertisers, suggesting the problem is diminishing. Still, the issue is far from being taken care of thanks to AI‚Äôs ability to rapidly generate junk websites that can go undetected. There are steps marketers can take to mitigate harm, like focusing less on high clickthrough rates and weighing long-term KPIs more heavily. This article is part of EMARKETER‚Äôs client-only subscription Briefings‚Äîdaily newsletters authored by industry analysts who are experts in marketing, advertising, media, and tech trends. To help you finish 2024 strong, and start 2025 off on the right foot, articles like this one‚Äîdelivering the latest news and insights‚Äîare completely free through January 31, 2025. author: Jeff Wald
title: Gophers hold Pro Day for 17 players in front of all 32 NFL teams | FOX 9 Minneapolis-St. Paul
text:
The Brief The Gophers football team had its annual Pro Day on Wednesday at Athletes Village, with 17 players working out in front of 70 NFL personnel representing all 32 teams. Among the Vikings' staff in attendance were Kevin O'Connell, Kwesi Adofo-Mensah and Brian Flores. P.J. Fleck has had 19 players selected in the NFL Draft over 7 seasons. MINNEAPOLIS (FOX 9) - It was a special day for the University of Minnesota football team as they hosted their annual Pro Day at Athletes Village.
The Gophers haD six players in Indianapolis at the recent NFL Scouting Combine. Wednesday, they had 17 players workout in front of about 70 representatives from all 32 NFL teams. It was their best chance to be seen in front of front office personnel and staff ahead of the NFL Draft, which is April 24-26 in Green Bay, Wis.
Who participated in Pro Day? What we know:
Here‚Äôs a list of the 17 players who participated:
Max Brosmer (QB) Quinn Carroll (OL) Tyler Cooper (OL) Mark Crawford (P) Aireontae Ersery (OL) Jack Henderson (S) Daniel Jackson (WR) Jah Joyner (DL) Cody Lindenberg (LB) Nick Kallerup (TE) Dragan Kesich (K) Marcus Major (RB) Jaren Mangham (RB) Ethan Robinson (DB) Elijah Spencer (WR) Danny Striggow (DL) Justin Walley (DB)\ Gophers‚Äô recent history in NFL Draft Why you should care:
Minnesota has had a first or second round pick in five straight drafts, from 2020-24. That hasn‚Äôt happened since the 1940s. The Gophers are one of 13 programs to have a pick in the first or second round in each of the last five drafts ‚Äì joining Alabama, Clemson, Florida, Georgia, LSU, Michigan, Notre Dame, Ohio State, Oklahoma, Oregon, Penn State and USC ‚Äì many of the perennial powers in college football.
The Gophers have also had at least one draft pick in the last six drafts, and have had 19 players drafted over P.J. Fleck‚Äôs seven seasons as head coach.
Spring football What's next:
Minnesota starts Spring Practice on Thursday. The Gophers open the 2025 regular season on Thursday, Aug. 28, against Buffalo at Huntington Bank Stadium.
Minnesota Golden Gophers Sports

author: AIRLIVE
title: Plenty of lucky passengers during past night!
text:
Last night was an amazing opportunity for lucky passengers to see northern lights over Northern Europe. The Northern Lights have splashed vivid colour across Northern Europe skies once again, with stunning images captured all across the country.

Amazing to see from our flight last night ‚úàÔ∏è Belfast ‚Äì Palma WOW! First time for me experiencing #northernlights #auroresboreales üòç @bbcniweather @barrabest @angie_weather pic.twitter.com/Qmi6yamw3M
‚Äî Lindsey Hall (@elinshall) October 11, 2024 Starting around 18:00 UTC many passengers were able to view the aurora. It then weakened slightly for a time, before coming back even stronger around midnight and continued until dawn on Friday.
Even kind pilots made sure all the passengers were able to watch the show by performing a little detour like this easyJet flight from Porto, Portugal to Bristol, UK.

author: Jonas Terrado
title: TNT deals Terrafirma another rout, eyes Converge payback
text:
TNT import Rondae Hollis-Jefferson.‚ÄìPBA IMAGES
TNT ended the first round of the PBA Governors‚Äô Cup in good spirits after winning four of five games despite dealing with banged bodies.
And now coach Chot Reyes, Rondae Hollis-Jefferson and the Tropang Giga, who on Thursday produced a 107-89 defeat of the winless Terrafirma Dyip at Ninoy Aquino Stadium, head into the latter end of the group stage facing the team that served as a dent to their impressive record thus far.
Article continues after this advertisement Will TNT, tied with Meralco atop Group A, come into Sunday‚Äôs matchup against Converge at the same venue with a chip on its shoulders?
FEATURED STORIES SPORTS PBA: June Mar Fajardo buzzer-beater shoots San Miguel past Rain or Shine SPORTS PVL: Jeered and booed Akari couldn‚Äôt handle crowd, admits Minowa SPORTS WNBA: Kelsey Mitchell strong complement to Caitlin Clark at Fever ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt avoid that, that‚Äôs unavoidable,‚Äù Reyes said. ‚ÄúBut we don‚Äôt approach games that way. We approach games as they are.
‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt have any external or extra motivations or a chip on our shoulder, except that it is an important ballgame for us and we need to be ready with our best effort,‚Äù added the Tropang Giga mentor.
Article continues after this advertisement It was that game where TNT fell victim to a last-second four-point shot courtesy of Converge import Scotty Hopson, the situation compounded at the worst way for the Tropang Giga when instructions to foul with the FiberXers in penalty were not heeded.
Article continues after this advertisement The Tropang Giga have since rebounded from that 96-95 loss with two consecutive victories, including the mastery of the Dyip despite missing Calvin Oftana due to a hip problem. A win over the FiberXers in their upcoming meeting may serve well for them moving forward.
Article continues after this advertisement 21.2 losing average ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre on the same page here, we want to win and we got to do what we have to do; listening to coaches, going over the little things, learning from our mistakes from the last time we played them and staying focus for 48 minutes, you know, the game isn‚Äôt over till it‚Äôs over,‚Äù said Hollis-Jefferson.
‚ÄúSo I feel like if we do that, we‚Äôll be in a good bubble,‚Äù added Hollis-Jefferson, who racked up 26 points, 11 rebounds, seven assists and two blocks for TNT despite playing through an ankle injury.
Article continues after this advertisement RR Pogoy, Poy Erram and Kim Aurin were also key for the Tropang Giga in sending the Dyip winless in the first round.
Terrafirma was without two key players in Juami Tiongson and Kemark Carino, with the former perhaps the most sorely missed for his scoring ability.
Import Antonio Hester and Christian Standhardinger, despite the shortage in manpower, did make Terrafirma stay close for three periods until TNT pulled away in the latter stretch of the fourth.
